title: Poseidon 2013 Boon Fly's Hill Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A vivid buttered-popcorn aroma and luscious vanilla and lemon-meringue flavors make this wine frothy and mouthfilling. Made in 100% new Hungarian oak barrels and aged for 20 months, it's full-bodied, so rich in texture that it seems almost sweet, with good balancing support from mild acidity.

title: Seghesio 2012 Venom Rattlesnake Hill Vineyard Sangiovese (Alexander Valley)
description: Burly and powerful, this is an explosively complex and satisfying wine, full bodied and brooding in black cherry and tobacco, its tannins mild and lengthy.

title: Loimer 2013 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Niederösterreich)
description: The nose signals crunchy, crisp red apple, which also follows through on the sprightly, wonderfully foamy and fresh palate of exquisitely small bubbles. This is light but full-fruited, brimming with all the crunch of Red Delicious and Braeburn apples supported by just a little shortbread richness from the yeast. There is concentration and poise, utter freshness and quite a bit of length.

title: Loimer 2013 Extra Brut Sparkling (Niederösterreich)
description: A lovely rich apple scent of Golden Pearmain pervades nose and palate of this fresh sparkler. The palate is fresh and light-bodied, yet characterized by an almost honeyed richness of apple notes and freshly baked apple crumble. The finish is wonderfully dry, full-fruited, fresh and long.

title: Helwig 2013 Graciano (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This surprisingly rich, concentrated and full-bodied wine has delicious spicy oak accents and an easy-sippng texture. The color is a very dark, deep red. Aromas are grapy, jammy and fresh, and the flavors convey ripe blackberry and plum.

title: Krupp Brothers 2010 Stagecoach Vineyard Veraison Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine from the producer's famous vineyard is sanguine in red currant and woody tannin. Full bodied and substantial in body and spirit, it has alluring aromatics of sage and mountain brush, remaining balanced in acidity despite the intensity and power.

title: Landmark 2014 Damaris Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Spicy, lemony acidity balances out a classic barrel imprint of oakiness and toast in this medium-bodied, concentrated wine. Silky-smooth on the palate, it rewards patience in the glass and will pair well with rich, creamy foods.

title: Trisaetum 2014 Coast Range Estate Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This estate vineyard is generally prone to cool-site characteristics, meaning more of an emphasis on leaf and root and herb. Peppery herb and tart red fruits combine in an elegant, precise midpalate, suggesting wild strawberry and carrying a dash of sea salt caramel through the finish.

title: Château Tessendey 2014  Fronsac
description: Owned by one of the top wine families in nearby Pomerol, this is a structured and finely ripe wine. It has great balance between the tannins and the black currants. Packed with fruit and the barest hints of wood aging, it is developing well and will be ready from 2018.

title: Churchill's 2013 Churchill's Estates Touriga Nacional (Douro)
description: From Churchill's Quinta da Gricha estate, this is a pure Touriga Nacional. Rich and delicately perfumed, it is a ripe fruity wine, full of tannins as well as concentrated black fruits. Wood aging has smoothed some of the tannins, although the wine needs to age further. Drink from 2018.

title: Portal del Priorat 2014 Somni Carignan-Syrah (Priorat)
description: Potent, borderline fiery aromas of blackberry and cassis are heavily charred and smoky. This plump, ripe, chewy Carignan-Syrah blend is full of toast, black pepper and dark-berry flavors. A toasty, spicy finish with medium tannins runs on and on; drink 2017–2022.

title: Colinas do Douro 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: The first reserva release from a new Douro project, this is an impressive rich start. It has a generous texture, ripe black fruits and concentrated, still young, tannins. With its mineral texture, it is a wine that should age further, so drink from 2018.

title: Corte Moschina 2010 Metodo Classico Brut Riserva  (Lessini Durello)
description: This fragrant sparkler offers aromas of pressed white flower, citrus zest, bread crust and a whiff of cake spice. The vibrant elegant palate tastes of tangerine, candied lemon drop, golden apple, crushed herb and ginger. Lively acidity brightens the rich flavors while an almond note backs up the finish.

title: De Venoge NV Princes Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This is a beautiful, pure Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs, crisp and tight with a strongly mineral character. On the dry side of brut it brings out perfumed apple and lime fruits along with an orange-zest tang. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Castello di Neive 2012 Metodo Classico Pinot Nero (Piemonte)
description: Made with Pinot Nero, this fresh, elegant sparkler offers delicate scents of berry, orchard fruit, chopped herb and bread crust. The smooth, refined palate delivers red apple, tangerine zest, strawberry and mineral alongside a soft, persistent mousse and bright acidity.

title: Chalk Hill 2012 Clara's Vineyard Red (Chalk Hill)
description: From an estate vineyard, this wine combines 60% Cabernet Sauvignon with 20% Malbec and 20% Petit Verdot. Brick tar, blackberry and smoked meat show first, followed by leather and black pepper. Medium acidity and body weight make way for firm, integrated tannin. If you allow the wine to open over a couple of hours in the glass, it'll share further flavors of chocolate and vanilla.

title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2014 Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)
description: At first, the abundant apple notes seem crisp and green. On the palate they attain the mellowness of ripe Golden Delicious apples and the aroma of yellow plums. There is a pleasant autolytic background of sponge-cake and shortbread, balanced by lovely aromatic lemon freshness and fine mousse. The finish is absolutely dry and very pure.

title: Charles Cimicky 2013 Trumps Shiraz (Barossa)
description: Cedar and vanilla notes blend easily with hints of raspberry, pepper and earth on the nose. The flavors are darker and plummier, framed by supple tannins, while the finish is long, silky and spice-inflected.

title: Château Brethous 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
description: From organic and biodynamic vineyards, this wine is full of ripe berry fruits backed up by firm tannins, this is a wine that is full of potential. It has structure, a fine form of rich fruit and acidity. With its dense texture this is a wine to age. So just wait until 2019.

title: Altemasi 2008 Pas Dosé Metodo Classico Sparkling (Trento)
description: Vibrant and elegant, this radiant sparkler has enticing aromas of wild flower, apple, graphite, Alpine herb and a whiff of bread crust. The fresh linear palate delivers ripe pear, nectarine, mineral and a hint of toasted almond alongside lively acidity. The bone-dry finish closes crisp and clean.

title: Amici 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This well-made wine opens in earthy compost and black licorice before unwinding a topknot of grippy tannin. Even with its power and concentration, it offers velvety mouthfeel and an expansive wave of juicy, robust acidity, particularly on the finish, making good use of smaller additions of Cab Franc, Petit Verdot, Malbec and Merlot.

title: Antiquum Farm 2015 Aurosa Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This unusual rosé is all Pinot Gris, picked for thick skins, chewy tannins, high acidity, and given a 36-hour cold soak prior to fermentation. It's a pale salmon/copper shade, full-bodied and juicy, with fruit flavors of peach and citrus. Highlights of hibiscus tea and floral aromatics contribute further complexity.

title: Balletto 2014 Winery Block Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Winery Block is four acres situated around the producer's winemaking facility, a small band of sandy soil. The resulting wine is tart in cherry and pomegranate, with tight acidity and plenty of freshness on the palate. Highlights of citrus and cola spice interweave effortlessly within.

title: Barone Pizzini 2009 Bagnadore Metodo Classico Riserva  (Franciacorta)
description: A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Nero, this opens with subtle aromas of toasted bread crust, mature pear and a note of wild herb. The elegant palate—which is made without dosage—offers ripe Golden Delicious apple, sour lemon drop and hazelnut alongside a refined perlage.

title: Besserat de Bellefon NV Cuvée des Moines Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is the driest of the wines in this producer's range. A high proportion of Pinot Meunier gives it fruitiness to balance the dryness. It is light and poised with white fruits and good acidity. The mineral texture makes this balanced Champagne a match with many salty foods.

title: Billecart-Salmon NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This pale-pink wine is stylish, crisp and relatively dry. Full of wild strawberry and citrus, it is lively, bright and lightly perfumed. The texture shows a touch of tannin as well as delicate minerality. Drink this well-balanced wine now.

title: Bodegas Escudero 2008 Vidau  (Rioja)
description: Rooty/ berry aromas come with a big heaping of mature earth tones and cool cola accents. This is ripped with acidity, which makes sense since 2008 was a chilly, wet year. Bold berry, plum, cherry and tobacco flavors finish easy and smooth; drink through 2020.

title: Muscardini 2012 Pauli Ranch Barbera (Redwood Valley)
description: A dramatic oak influence brings aromas of wood smoke and nutmeg to this ripe and otherwise fruity wine. The flavors are vivid raspberry and red cherry, and the texture is smooth with a good coating of tannin for mouthfeel.

title: Naggiar 2013 La Boheme Estate Grown, Produced and Bottled Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Great concentration in aroma and flavor goes with an almost creamy texture in this muscular, full-bodied and dry Bordeaux-style blend. It has a very deep color, considerable tannins that seem to melt in the mouth and a lingering finish. The blend gives almost equal weight to Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, plus some Malbec and Petit Verdot.
designation: La Boheme Estate Grown, Produced and Bottled

title: Ruhlmann NV Harmonie de Rosé Brut Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Soft notes of red plum and cream on the nose come to full fruition on the dry palate, which is rich with biscuity, bready autolysis notes. The dosage is restrained and thus features glimpses of red currant and red apple. The mousse is fine and while this makes a lovely and grown-up apéritif, it will also work alongside subtle cooking.
